item.description:
http://www.qcc.mass.edu/brink/trav-rec/mt_monad/mmpumpelly.html
Distance from parking to summit:  
about 4.5 miles (6.4 km)
Ascending time: 
Three hours plus.
Descending time: 
About three hours.
Difficulty rating/rank: 
2/2
Crowd Factor:
2 (on a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being near-continuous contact with others.) You may meet an occasional person on the trail, or see fresh footprints.
Access:
Lake Rd., Dublin, off Route 101.
Trail marker:
Cairns.
Average Grade:
11%. Steepest 660 yards: 24%

It’s named after the man who blazed it in 1883, Raphael Pumpelly, a world-famous geologist and Harvard professor who had a summer home on Snow Hill high above the eastern shore of Dublin Lake. Basically he created his own trail from his house to the summit. The lower end has been relocated several times because it crosses over very valuable private property. The trial is not used much because there is no parking area except along the road. Pumpelly was a kind of Victorian era Indiana Jones, famous for his long beard, which stretched down to his belt buckle, and for being the first adventurer to explore the wilds of Mongolia.
item.why: Excellent views, lots of ridge walking above tree line!

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: MONADNOCK - PUMPELLY TRAIL - 3,166' -9 miles round trip
